Redirects added to an Apache group can b: Redirects added to an Apache group can be saved to an {{code}}.htaccess{{/code}} file by adding the full path here. For reference, your WordPress is installed to {{code}}%(installed)s{{/code}}.
Your target URL contains the invalid cha: Your target URL contains the invalid character {{code}}%(invalid)s{{/code}}
If you are using WordPress 5.2 or newer: If you are using WordPress 5.2 or newer then look at your {{link}}Site Health{{/link}} and resolve any issues.
If you do not complete the manual instal: If you do not complete the manual install you will be returned here.
If your site needs special database perm: If your site needs special database permissions, or you would rather do it yourself, you can manually run the following SQL.
Insufficient database permissions detect: Insufficient database permissions detected. Please give your database user appropriate permissions.
This information is provided for debuggi: This information is provided for debugging purposes. Be careful making any changes.
Redirection communicates with WordPress: Redirection communicates with WordPress through the WordPress REST API. This is a standard part of WordPress, and you will experience problems if you cannot use it.
Do not change unless advised to do so!: Do not change unless advised to do so!
Export to CSV, Apache .htaccess, Nginx,: Export to CSV, Apache .htaccess, Nginx, or Redirection JSON. The JSON format contains full information, and other formats contain partial information appropriate to the format.
CSV does not include all information, an: CSV does not include all information, and everything is imported/exported as "URL only" matches. Use the JSON format for a full set of data.
All imports will be appended to the curr: All imports will be appended to the current database - nothing is merged.
Please make a backup of your Redirection: Please make a backup of your Redirection data: {{download}}downloading a backup{{/download}}. If you experience any issues you can import this back into Redirection.
Click the \"Upgrade Database\" button to: Click the "Upgrade Database" button to automatically upgrade the database.
Redirection stores data in your database: Redirection stores data in your database and sometimes this needs upgrading. Your database is at version {{strong}}%(current)s{{/strong}} and the latest is {{strong}}%(latest)s{{/strong}}.
Note that you will need to set the Apach: Note that you will need to set the Apache module path in your Redirection options.
You will need at least one working REST: You will need at least one working REST API to continue.
You are using a broken REST API route. C: You are using a broken REST API route. Changing to a working API should fix the problem.
Your REST API is not working and the plu: Your REST API is not working and the plugin will not be able to continue until this is fixed.
There are some problems connecting to yo: There are some problems connecting to your REST API. It is not necessary to fix these problems and the plugin is able to work.
Your target URL should be an absolute UR: Your target URL should be an absolute URL like {{code}}https://domain.com/%(url)s{{/code}} or start with a slash {{code}}/%(url)s{{/code}}.
Your source is the same as a target and: Your source is the same as a target and this will create a loop. Leave a target blank if you do not want to take action.
The target URL you want to redirect, or: The target URL you want to redirect, or auto-complete on post name or permalink.
Include these details in your report alo: Include these details in your report along with a description of what you were doing and a screenshot.
Please {{strong}}create an issue{{/stron: Please {{strong}}create an issue{{/strong}} or send it in an {{strong}}email{{/strong}}.
WordPress returned an unexpected message: WordPress returned an unexpected message. This is probably a PHP error from another plugin.
This could be a security plugin, or your: This could be a security plugin, or your server is out of memory or has an external error. Please check your server error log
Your REST API is returning a 404 page. T: Your REST API is returning a 404 page. This may be caused by a security plugin, or your server may be misconfigured
Your REST API is probably being blocked: Your REST API is probably being blocked by a security plugin. Please disable this, or configure it to allow REST API requests.
Read this REST API guide for more inform: Read this REST API guide for more information.
Your REST API is being cached. Please cl: Your REST API is being cached. Please clear any caching plugin and any server cache, logout, clear your browser cache, and try again.
WordPress permalink structures do not wo: WordPress permalink structures do not work in normal URLs. Please use a regular expression.
Pass - as ignore, but also copies the qu: Pass - as ignore, but also copies the query parameters to the target
Ignore - as exact, but ignores any query: Ignore - as exact, but ignores any query parameters not in your source
Exact - matches the query parameters exa: Exact - matches the query parameters exactly defined in your source, in any order
Applies to all redirections unless you c: Applies to all redirections unless you configure them otherwise.
Ignore and pass all query parameters: Ignore and pass all query parameters
Ignore & pass parameters to the target: Ignore & pass parameters to the target
Exact match all parameters in any order: Exact match all parameters in any order
That's all there is to it - you are now: That's all there is to it - you are now redirecting! Note that the above is just an example - you can now enter a redirect.
(Example) The target URL is the new URL: (Example) The target URL is the new URL
(Example) The source URL is your old or: (Example) The source URL is your old or original URL
A database upgrade is in progress. Pleas: A database upgrade is in progress. Please continue to finish.
Redirection's database needs to be updat: Redirection's database needs to be updated - click to update.
You have different URLs configured on yo: You have different URLs configured on your WordPress Settings > General page, which is usually an indication of a misconfiguration, and it can cause problems with the REST API. Please review your settings.
If you do experience a problem then plea: If you do experience a problem then please consult your plugin documentation, or try contacting your host support. This is generally {{link}}not a problem caused by Redirection{{/link}}.
Some other plugin that blocks the REST A: Some other plugin that blocks the REST API
A server firewall or other server config: A server firewall or other server configuration (e.g OVH)
Redirection uses the {{link}}WordPress R: Redirection uses the {{link}}WordPress REST API{{/link}} to communicate with WordPress. This is enabled and working by default. Sometimes the REST API is blocked by:
Storing the IP address allows you to per: Storing the IP address allows you to perform additional log actions. Note that you will need to adhere to local laws regarding the collection of data (for example GDPR).
Store IP information for redirects and 4: Store IP information for redirects and 404 errors.
Storing logs for redirects and 404s will: Storing logs for redirects and 404s will allow you to see what is happening on your site. This will increase your database storage requirements.
Keep a log of all redirects and 404 erro: Keep a log of all redirects and 404 errors.
If you change the permalink in a post or: If you change the permalink in a post or page then Redirection can automatically create a redirect for you.
Monitor permalink changes in WordPress p: Monitor permalink changes in WordPress posts and pages
These are some options you may want to e: These are some options you may want to enable now. They can be changed at any time.
When ready please press the button to co: When ready please press the button to continue.
First you will be asked a few questions,: First you will be asked a few questions, and then Redirection will set up your database.
Check a URL is being redirected: Check a URL is being redirected
More powerful URL matching, including {{: More powerful URL matching, including {{regular}}regular expressions{{/regular}}, and {{other}}other conditions{{/other}}
{{link}}Import{{/link}} from .htaccess,: {{link}}Import{{/link}} from .htaccess, CSV, and a variety of other plugins
{{link}}Monitor 404 errors{{/link}}, get: {{link}}Monitor 404 errors{{/link}}, get detailed information about the visitor, and fix any problems
Some features you may find useful are: Some features you may find useful are
Full documentation can be found on the {: Full documentation can be found on the {{link}}Redirection website.{{/link}}
A simple redirect involves setting a {{s: A simple redirect involves setting a {{strong}}source URL{{/strong}} (the old URL) and a {{strong}}target URL{{/strong}} (the new URL). Here's an example:
How do I use this plugin?: How do I use this plugin?
Redirection is designed to be used on si: Redirection is designed to be used on sites with a few redirects to sites with thousands of redirects.
Thank you for installing and using Redir: Thank you for installing and using Redirection v%(version)s. This plugin will allow you to manage 301 redirections, keep track of 404 errors, and improve your site, with no knowledge of Apache or Nginx needed.
This will redirect everything, including: This will redirect everything, including the login pages. Please be sure you want to do this.
To prevent a greedy regular expression y: To prevent a greedy regular expression you can use {{code}}^{{/code}} to anchor it to the start of the URL. For example: {{code}}%(example)s{{/code}}
Remember to enable the \"regex\" option: Remember to enable the "regex" option if this is a regular expression.
The source URL should probably start wit: The source URL should probably start with a {{code}}/{{/code}}
This will be converted to a server redir: This will be converted to a server redirect for the domain {{code}}%(server)s{{/code}}.
Anchor values are not sent to the server: Anchor values are not sent to the server and cannot be redirected.
Leaving before the process has completed: Leaving before the process has completed may cause problems.
Please remain on this page until complet: Please remain on this page until complete.
If you want to {{support}}ask for suppor: If you want to {{support}}ask for support{{/support}} please include these details:
Please complete your <a href=\"%s\">Redi: Please complete your Redirection setup to activate the plugin.
Your database does not need updating to: Your database does not need updating to %s.
Site and home URL are inconsistent. Plea: Site and home URL are inconsistent. Please correct from your Settings > General page: %1$1s is not %2$2s
Please do not try and redirect all your: Please do not try and redirect all your 404s - this is not a good thing to do.
Only the 404 page type is currently supp: Only the 404 page type is currently supported.
Describe the purpose of this redirect (o: Describe the purpose of this redirect (optional)
Target URL when not matched (empty to ig: Target URL when not matched (empty to ignore)
Target URL when matched (empty to ignore: Target URL when matched (empty to ignore)
Delete all logs for these entries: Delete all logs for these entries
Delete all logs for this entry: Delete all logs for this entry
Enter full URL, including http:// or htt: Enter full URL, including http:// or https://
Sometimes your browser can cache a URL,: Sometimes your browser can cache a URL, making it hard to know if it's working as expected. Use this to check a URL to see how it is really redirecting.
URL is not being redirected with Redirec: URL is not being redirected with Redirection
URL is being redirected with Redirection: URL is being redirected with Redirection
Enter server URL to match against: Enter server URL to match against
Match against this browser referrer text: Match against this browser referrer text
Match against this browser user agent: Match against this browser user agent
The relative URL you want to redirect fr: The relative URL you want to redirect from
Note it is your responsibility to pass H: Note it is your responsibility to pass HTTP headers to PHP. Please contact your hosting provider for support about this.
If you are using a caching system such a: If you are using a caching system such as Cloudflare then please read this:
How Redirection uses the REST API - don': How Redirection uses the REST API - don't change unless necessary
Take a look at the {{link}}plugin status: Take a look at the {{link}}plugin status{{/link}}. It may be able to identify and "magic fix" the problem.
{{link}}Caching software{{/link}}, in pa: {{link}}Caching software{{/link}}, in particular Cloudflare, can cache the wrong thing. Try clearing all your caches.
{{link}}Please temporarily disable other: {{link}}Please temporarily disable other plugins!{{/link}} This fixes so many problems.
Please see the <a href=\"https://redirec: Please see the list of common problems.
Your WordPress REST API has been disable: Your WordPress REST API has been disabled. You will need to enable it for Redirection to continue working
Something went wrong obtaining this info: Something went wrong obtaining this information
This is an IP from a private network. Th: This is an IP from a private network. This means it is located inside a home or business network and no more information can be displayed.
No details are known for this address.
Please note that Redirection requires th: Please note that Redirection requires the WordPress REST API to be enabled. If you have disabled this then you won't be able to use Redirection
You can find full documentation about us: You can find full documentation about using Redirection on the redirection.me support site.
Full documentation for Redirection can b: Full documentation for Redirection can be found at {{site}}https://redirection.me{{/site}}. If you have a problem please check the {{faq}}FAQ{{/faq}} first.
If you want to report a bug please read: If you want to report a bug please read the {{report}}Reporting Bugs{{/report}} guide.
If you want to submit information that y: If you want to submit information that you don't want in a public repository then send it directly via {{email}}email{{/email}} - include as much information as you can!
How long to cache redirected 301 URLs (v: How long to cache redirected 301 URLs (via "Expires" HTTP header)
Are you sure you want to import from %s?: Are you sure you want to import from %s?
The following redirect plugins were dete: The following redirect plugins were detected on your site and can be imported from.
Redirection requires WordPress v%1$1s, y: Redirection requires WordPress v%1$s, you are using v%2$s - please update your WordPress
Create associated redirect (added to end: Create associated redirect (added to end of URL)
<code>Redirectioni10n</code> is not defi: Redirectioni10n is not defined. This usually means another plugin is blocking Redirection from loading. Please disable all plugins and try again.
If the magic button doesn't work then yo: If the magic button doesn't work then you should read the error and see if you can fix it manually, otherwise follow the 'Need help' section below.
Your server has rejected the request for: Your server has rejected the request for being too big. You will need to change it to continue.
Also check if your browser is able to lo: Also check if your browser is able to load redirection.js:
If you are using a page caching plugin o: If you are using a page caching plugin or service (CloudFlare, OVH, etc) then you can also try clearing that cache.
All redirects have a valid group: All redirects have a valid group
No valid groups, so you will not be able: No valid groups, so you will not be able to create any redirects
Please clear your browser cache and relo: Please clear your browser cache and reload this page.
WordPress did not return a response. Thi: WordPress did not return a response. This could mean an error occurred or that the request was blocked. Please check your server error_log.
If you think Redirection is at fault the: If you think Redirection is at fault then create an issue.
This may be caused by another plugin - l: This may be caused by another plugin - look at your browser's error console for more details.
{{strong}}CSV file format{{/strong}}: {{: {{strong}}CSV file format{{/strong}}: {{code}}source URL, target URL{{/code}} - and can be optionally followed with {{code}}regex, http code{{/code}} ({{code}}regex{{/code}} - 0 for no, 1 for yes).
Redirection is not working. Try clearing: Redirection is not working. Try clearing your browser cache and reloading this page.
If that doesn't help, open your browser': If that doesn't help, open your browser's error console and create a {{link}}new issue{{/link}} with the details.
Please note that any support is provide: Please note that any support is provide on as-time-is-available basis and is not guaranteed. I do not provide paid support.
Used to auto-generate a URL if no URL is: Used to auto-generate a URL if no URL is given. Use the special tags {{code}}$dec${{/code}} or {{code}}$hex${{/code}} to insert a unique ID instead

Double-check the file is the correct for: Double-check the file is the correct format!

Title: Title
Sorry, something went wrong loading the: Sorry, something went wrong loading the data - please try again
Delete the logs - are you sure?: Delete the logs - are you sure?
Once deleted your current logs will no l: Once deleted your current logs will no longer be available. You can set a delete schedule from the Redirection options if you want to do this automatically.
Thanks for subscribing! {{a}}Click here{: Thanks for subscribing! {{a}}Click here{{/a}} if you need to return to your subscription.
Want to keep up to date with changes to: Want to keep up to date with changes to Redirection?
Sign up for the tiny Redirection newslet: Sign up for the tiny Redirection newsletter - a low volume newsletter about new features and changes to the plugin. Ideal if you want to test beta changes before release.
You've supported this plugin - thank you: You've supported this plugin - thank you!
You get useful software and I get to car: You get useful software and I get to carry on making it better.
Delete the plugin - are you sure?: Delete the plugin - are you sure?
Deleting the plugin will remove all your: Deleting the plugin will remove all your redirections, logs, and settings. Do this if you want to remove the plugin for good, or if you want to reset the plugin.
Once deleted your redirections will stop: Once deleted your redirections will stop working. If they appear to continue working then please clear your browser cache.
Manage all your 301 redirects and monito: Manage all your 301 redirects and monitor 404 errors.
Redirection is free to use - life is won: Redirection is free to use - life is wonderful and lovely! It has required a great deal of time and effort to develop and you can help support this development by {{strong}}making a small donation{{/strong}}.
Selecting this option will delete all re: Selecting this option will delete all redirections, all logs, and any options associated with the Redirection plugin.  Make sure this is what you want to do.
A unique token allowing feed readers acc: A unique token allowing feed readers access to Redirection log RSS (leave blank to auto-generate)
I'm a nice person and I have helped supp: I'm a nice person and I have helped support the author of this plugin.
Use groups to organise your redirects. G: Use groups to organise your redirects. Groups are assigned to a module, which affects how the redirects in that group work. If you are unsure then stick to the WordPress module.
